job_title: Early Childhood Educator in Vancouver, BC
pros: Positive working environment and flexible lesson planning.

job_title: Child and Youth Worker in Vancouver, BC
pros: Opportunities for lateral and vertical movement, clear strong policies and procedures put into action to ensure safety of staff and clients
cons: The hours were not sustainable as it was a mix of part time and full time - hence a lot of turn over in staff

review_title: Great Fulfilling job if caring is your passion but.
job_title: Residential Care Worker in Vancouver, BC
pros: Great Pay Great Benefits A few nice colleagues
cons: Staffing manager doesnt care as long as they can cover someone's absence. Forced overtime/extension of shift when no one is available to cover nice incoming staff if they call in sick. Some managers play favoritism, especially to those who they have been working with long time ago/ pirated from another company. Some managers are incompentent, disregarding health issues of a client addressed to them.

job_title: Residential Support Worker in Richmond, BC
pros: Clients are great, staff not bad. Management worst ever.
cons: Bad upper management. Toxic environment allowed to continue.

job_title: Early Childhood Educator in Vancouver, BC
pros: the team i work with is great, manager is understanding, compassionate, and fair, families i work with are great
cons: the company itself has dwindled in budget- i feel underappreciated as an employee- no longer have funded events, or professional development.

review_title: it was great working at dda
Loved the people and the work
job_title: Early Childhood Educator in Vancouver, BC
pros:
Great staff 
Cooperative team and Manager 
Loved working with the kids 
Flexible playbased curriculum
Good benefits
cons:
Like any child care job it can be physically and emotionally exhausting
Does not include the BC wage enhancement - feel like we were being underpaid for the work we do

pros:

job_title: Life Skills Worker in Vancouver, BC
pros: Flexible and allows you to help others
cons: The position could be better compensated

job_title: Residential Care Worker in Vancouver, BC
pros: great co-workers, working with the clients
cons: as a casual staff it's hard to build relationships with clients. The level of support from different managers varies. Some better than others.

job_title: Child and Youth Worker in Vancouver, BC
pros: Staff were friendly and the job is rewarding

job_title: Early Childhood Educator in Vancouver, BC
pros: Diverse teachers. Excellent teaching teams. Very good pay. Very good benefits. M-F daytime job.
cons: This field can be physically and emotionally taxing.

pros: Great staff, open-minded to new ideas, we can try new things to see what works and what doesn't, great flexibility, engaged CEO, lots to learn, overall an excellent mission to provide services for those that society might overlook.
cons: I'm still new, so nothing cons to report. I have a hard time thinking there might be one!

job_title: Community Support Worker in Vancouver, BC
pros: DDA provides a healthy environment for people with developmental disabilities to learn, grow, and socialize.  Working in this environment was very rewarding.
cons: High turnover rates of support staff.

pros: Great entry level employment, good work enviornment
cons:
Low wage.
Mileage was paid back to us but did not compensate for the amount we spent in Vancouver traffic!
